We should consider whether Student_D is likely to apply to School_D: Student_D’s preferences rank School_D last, so it is very unlikely they will apply unless rejected everywhere else, which may not happen within 30 rounds. Therefore, the rational move to maximize expected outcome is to accept Student_E now rather than risk losing them while waiting for an unlikely Student_D application. Also, Student_E states readiness to commit, reducing risk of reneging (not modeled, but consistent with commitment).
